Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.view.Components

Class CellView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
com.example.miniproyecto4.view.Components.CellView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class CellView extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
Visual component representing an individual cell on the game board. Displays different states: empty, ship, hit, miss, and sunk. Handles mouse events for user interaction and displays placement previews. Extends StackPane to layer multiple visual elements.

  • Property Summary

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Constructor Details

    • CellView

      public CellView(double size)
      Constructs a CellView with the specified size. Initializes the cell in empty state with water color and sets up mouse event handlers.
      Parameters:
      size - the size in pixels of the cell (width and height)

  • Method Details

    • setFill

      public void setFill(String color)
      Sets the fill color of the cell's background.
      Parameters:
      color - the color in hexadecimal format

    • showPreview

      public void showPreview(boolean isValid)
      Displays a visual preview of where a ship will be placed. Shows green for valid placement or red for invalid placement.
      Parameters:
      isValid - true if the position is valid (green/dark), false if invalid (red)

    • clearPreview

      public void clearPreview()
      Clears the visual preview and restores the original color.

    • markAsHit

      public void markAsHit()
      Marks the cell as hit. Changes the color and adds a visual hit marker.

    • markAsMiss

      public void markAsMiss()
      Marks the cell as water (missed shot). Adds an X as a visual indicator.

    • markAsShip

      public void markAsShip()
      Marks the cell as containing part of a ship. Changes the color to display the ship position.

    • markAsSunk

      public void markAsSunk()
      Marks the cell as part of a sunk ship. Changes the color and adds a sunk marker.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the cell to its initial empty state. Clears all visual markers and restores water color.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes the cell's visualization. Provided for compatibility; can be extended for future updates.

    • getCurrentState

      public String getCurrentState()
      Returns the current state of the cell.
      Returns:
      the current state (EMPTY, SHIP, HIT, MISS, or SUNK)
